fseq.reading package¶

fseq.reading.seq_encoder module¶

class fseq.reading.seq_encoder.FastQ[source]¶

Bases: fseq.reading.seq_encoder.SeqFormat

Detector of FASTQ format

..note:: This class can be subclassed to detect the different
quality-encoding schemes in the future.

Valid format:

@Contig_1
AACAATACGA
+Contig_1
@+>AACADGH
@Contig_2
CCATTTACGA
+
>CCAGJDFGH
SeqFormat
Base class for detectors
HEADER_LINE = 0¶
QUALITY_LINE = 3¶
SEQUENCE_LINE = 1¶

If SeqFormat.expects (the base class method) is called.

class fseq.reading.seq_encoder.FastaMultiline[source]¶

Bases: fseq.reading.seq_encoder.SeqFormat

Detector of multi-line FASTA

..note:: This format is not supported in the current implementation
as it has no predictable item-size.

Valid format:

>Contig_1
ACAATACA
GATTACA
>Contig_2
ACCCACA
>Contig_3
ACCAAACA
CCAACACA
ACAACCAC
SeqFormat
Base class for detectors
FastaSingleline
Derived class, with more restricitons

QUALITY_LINE = None¶
SEQUENCE_LINE = -1¶

exception fseq.reading.seq_encoder.FormatError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Sequence Format Error for exceptions relating to missmatches between encoders and sequence formats as well as lacking formattings in encoders and unknown sequence formats.

exception fseq.reading.seq_encoder.FormatImplementationError[source]¶

Bases: fseq.reading.seq_encoder.FormatError

Error for exposing parts of interface that needs to be overwritten in subclasses

Bases: fseq.reading.seq_encoder.FormatError

parse(lines, out, outindex)[source]¶

Placeholder parser overwritten when subclassing

lines: iterable of str
Iterable of length equal to self.itemSize containing the raw data for one item
out: numpy.ndarray
Array that will have values written to it
outIndex: object
Index for where the parse output should be written in the out array such that out[outIndex] gives a sufficiently large array that the result of parsing will fit in it.
NotImplemented
If base class parse not overwritten or base class used directly

class fseq.reading.seq_encoder.SeqFormat[source]¶

Bases: object

Base Class for implementing data format detectors.

The attributes present in subclass should overwrite the parent properties. All subclasses must also overwrite the SeqFormat.expects(line).

name itemSize hasSequence hasQuality qualityEncoding

HEADER_LINE = 0¶
MATCH_AA = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object at 0x2b9d05200f08>¶
MATCH_AA_S = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object at 0x2b9d069c21d0>¶
MATCH_NT = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object at 0x2b9d05200e40>¶
MATCH_NT_S = <_sre.SRE_Pattern object at 0x2b9d069cd030>¶
QUALITY_LINE = None¶
SEQUENCE_LINE = None¶

fseq.reading.seq_encoder.inheritDocFromSeqFormat(f)[source]¶

This decorator will copy the docstring from SeqFormat for the matching function f if such exists and no docstring has been added manually.

fseq.reading.seq_reader module¶

Module for reading sequence data

class fseq.reading.seq_reader.SeqReader(seqEncoder=None, dataSourcePaths=None, dataTargetPaths=None, reportBuilders=None, popDataSources=True, resetSeqEncoder=True, popEncodingResults=None, dataArrayConstructor=<built-in function zeros>, dataWidth=101, dataType=<type 'numpy.float16'>, verbose=False)[source]¶

Bases: object

Reads sequence data and encodes it.

The length of the sequence reader reflects the number of inputs to be processed.

The entire stack of inputs can be processed in bulk by invoking SeqReader.run() but the results of each encoding, omitting any report building can also be produced iteratively as shown in the examples.

dataArrayConstructor dataWidth dataType popDataSources popEncodingResults jobQueue reportBuilders reportDirectory SeqEncoder resetSeqEncoder results

To invoke the reader it can either be run : >>> seqReader.run() <fseq.reading.seq_reader.SeqReader at 0x7faf6970fd10>

or if more control is required, it can be iterated over: >>> for res in seqReader: ... reportBuilder.distill(res, dirname=seqReader.reportDirectory)

Both methods above yielding the same result with the difference that the first may store results in seqReader.results depending on the seqReader.popEncodingResults settings while the latter never keeps the results in the state of the instance.

DATA_INITIAL_SIZE = 100000¶
DEBUG = False¶
WORKERS = 32¶
addData(sourcePaths, targetPaths=None)[source]¶

Add a data source path to be analysed.

sourcePaths: string or iterable object
Either a path string or a collection of paths to data files
targetPaths: string or iterable object, optional

Either a relative path string or collection of relative paths. The path is relative to the respective data source. (Default: will create a folder in the same directory as the data source with the same name as the input suffixed by .reports.) ..note:: If supplied, must reflect equal number of outputs as

inputs in sourcePaths
fset.SeqReader
Returns self
ValueError
If target paths are supplied but don’t match in lenght with the number of source-paths

Part of iter interface, produces the encoding of the next data-source.

numpy.ndarray
Encoding output.
ValueError
If no encoder has been assigned.
StopIteration
If no more data-source exists.
popDataSources[source]¶

If sequence reader should remove data sources from list of sources when they have been read.

The general use case is to set this to True, but omitting popping can be useful if data may be needed to be re-read with a different encoder.

bool

popEncodingResults[source]¶

If the outcome of an encoding should be remove from memory as soon as report as been produced or iteration completed.

..note:: The process will require large amounts of memory if results are not popped and several large files analysed.

bool

removeReportBuilders(*builders)[source]¶

Removes all builders supplied, or all builders if no specific builder is supplied.

*args: fseq.ReportBuilder, optional
Any number of report builder references for report builders to be removed. If none is supplied, all report builders will be removed.
fset.SeqReader
Returns self

If current instance has three builders: >>> tuple(seqEncoder.reportBuilders) (b1, b2, b3)

The b2 and b3 can be removed by: >>> seqEncoder.removeReportBuilders(b2, b3) <fseq.reading.seq_reader.SeqReader at 0x7faf696e5810>

>>> tuple(seqEncoder.reportBuilders)
(b1, )

Alternatively all builders can be removed by: >>> seqEncoder.removeReportBuilders() <fseq.reading.seq_reader.SeqReader at 0x7faf696e5810>

>>> tuple(seqEncoder.reportBuilders)
()
reportBuilders[source]¶

The report builders associated with the reader.

If any, the reports will be destilled automatically at the end of SeqReader.run().

tuple
The currently assigned report builders
fseq.ReportBuilder.distill
Method for distilling encoded data.
reportDirectory[source]¶

The directory where reports for the last made encoding should go.

str
